name: Quizzical72: Easy Word Search9 | Brain Teasers | 25 Questions

questions.text: Barabbas is a fan of this Swedish pop group?
questions.explanation:
Abba & abba.

	barABBAs. Abba is the Swedish pop group.

questions.text: Is this plaything, slim or lean?
questions.explanation:
Thin & thin.

	playTHINg. Thin is to be slim or lean.

questions.text: Can jousting inflict a wound on, by injection of poison?
questions.explanation:
Sting & sting.

	jouSTING. To sting can inflict a wound on, by the injection of poison.

questions.text: Was John, the English poet of 'Paradise Lost', born in Hamilton the capital of Bermuda?
questions.explanation:
Milton & milton.

	haMILTON. John Milton was the author of 'Paradise Lost'.

questions.text: The card game baccarat uses a measure of the weight of precious stones?
questions.explanation:
Carat & carat.

	bacCARAT. Carat is a measure of weight of precious stones.

questions.text: Its unfortunate these large marine spiny-finned fish are called tunny?
questions.explanation:
Tuna & tuna.

	unforTUNAte. Another name for tunny is tuna which are large marine spiny-finned fish.

questions.text: Some of the representatives feel bitter or aggrieved?
questions.explanation:
Resent & resent.

	repRESENTatives. Resent is to feel bitter or aggrieved.

questions.text: Scold severely and chastise this Italian town famous for its sparkling wine?
questions.explanation:
Asti & asti.

	chASTIse. Asti is the Italian town famous for its sparkling wine.

questions.text: Galileo found the zodiacal constellation in the Northern hemisphere?
questions.explanation:
Leo & leo.

	galiLEO. Leo is the zodiacal constellation in the Northern hemisphere.

questions.text: Nicodemus devises a system of letters or digits used for identification?
questions.explanation:
Code & code.

	niCODEmus. A code is a system of letters or digits used for identification.

questions.text: The ballerina finds the archaic or poetic name for Ireland?
questions.explanation:
Erin & erin.

	ballERINa. Erin is an archaic or poetic name for Ireland.

questions.text: A white sheep or goat cheese popular in Greece is wrapped up in the thin, lustrous plain-weave fabric of taffeta?
questions.explanation:
Feta & feta.

	tafFETA. Feta is a white sheep or goat cheese popular in Greece.

questions.text: A gemstone used for making pestles and mortars is used in the game of bagatelle?
questions.explanation:
Agate & agate.

	bAGATElle. Agate is a gemstone and is used in making pestles and mortars.

questions.text: A person who puts on a false manner in order to deceive others is located at the factory?
questions.explanation:
Actor & actor.

	fACTORy. An actor can be a person who puts on a false manner in order to deceive others.

questions.text: The tungsten filament inside a light bulb emits light to cause an expression of sorrow?
questions.explanation:
Lament & lament.

	fiLAMENT. Lament is an expression of sorrow.

questions.text: They play the card game canasta in the town in Galilee where Jesus performed his first miracle of changing water into wine?
questions.explanation:
Cana & cana.

	CANAsta. Cana is the town in Galilee where Jesus performed his first miracle by changing water into wine.

questions.text: Rounded grains of quartz between 0.2 and 2 millimetres in diameter surround Barbra Streisand?
questions.explanation:
Sand & sand.

	streiSAND. Sand is rounded grains of quartz, between 0.2 and 2 millimetres in diameter.

questions.text: Did Thomas Edison's middle name originate from the apple brandy of calvados?
questions.explanation:
Alva & alva.

	cALVAdos. Thomas Alva Edison

questions.text: Scandinavian monetary unit worth one hundredth of a Danish or Norwegian krone is consumed by Lorelei, a siren in German legend?
questions.explanation:
Ore & ore.

	lORElei. Ore is a Scandinavian monetary unit worth one hundredth of a Danish or Norwegian krone.

questions.text: The artistic movement of the early 20th century was originated at Trinidad and Tobago?
questions.explanation:
Dada & dada.

	triniDAD And tobago. Dada is the artistic movement of the early 20th century.

questions.text: A phenomenon or occurrence regarded as a sign of future happiness or disaster lasted for only a moment?
questions.explanation:
Omen & omen.

	mOMENt. An omen is a phenomenon or occurrence regarded as a sign of future happiness or disaster.

questions.text: Is the state of being widely known or recognized found within the United States of America?
questions.explanation:
Fame & fame.

	oF AMErica. Fame is the state of being widely known or recognized.

questions.text: The Holy Roman Emperor (962-973) finally hit rock bottom, the lowest possible level?
questions.explanation:
Otto & otto.

	bOTTOm. Otto was the Holy Roman Emperor (962-973)

questions.text: A witty retort can lead you to a port in South Lebanon?
questions.explanation:
Tyre & tyre.

	witTY REtort. Tyre is a port in South Lebanon.

questions.text: A slender rod, usually wooden and often ornamental, is used for support when walking the plank with a buccaneer?
questions.explanation:
Cane & cane.

	bucCANEer. A cane is a slender rod, usually wooden and often ornamental and is used for support when walking. Hope you enjoyed the quiz. If you find an alternative answer to a question please let me know. Cheers, Quizzical.
